Class RobotTool

RobotTool class, defines the basic properties and methods for any Robot Tool.

Inheritance
System.Object
RobotTool
Inherited Members

System.Object.Equals(System.Object, System.Object)

System.Object.GetHashCode()
System.Object.GetType()
System.Object.MemberwiseClone()
Namespace: RobotComponents.Definitions
Assembly: RobotComponents.dll
Syntax
public class RobotTool

Constructors

RobotTool()

An empty constuctor that create the default robot tool tool0. The tool tool0 defines the wrist coordinate system, with the origin being the center of the mounting flange.

Declaration
public RobotTool()

RobotTool(RobotTool, Boolean)

Creates a new robot tool by duplicating an existing robot tool. This creates a deep copy of the existing robot tool.

Declaration
public RobotTool(RobotTool robotTool, bool duplicateMesh = true)
Parameters
Type Name Description
RobotTool robotTool

The robot tool that should be duplicated.
System.Boolean duplicateMesh

A boolean that indicates if the mesh should be duplicated.

RobotTool(String, Mesh, Plane, Plane)

Defines a robot tool from planes with load data as defined for the default tool tool0.

Declaration
public RobotTool(string name, Mesh mesh, Plane attachmentPlane, Plane toolPlane)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String name

The tool name, must be unique.
Rhino.Geometry.Mesh mesh

The tool mesh.
Rhino.Geometry.Plane attachmentPlane

The attachement plane.
Rhino.Geometry.Plane toolPlane

The tool center point and tool orientation as a plane.

RobotTool(String, Mesh, Plane, Plane, Boolean, Double, Vector3d, Quaternion, Vector3d)

Defines a robot tool with user defined load data.

Declaration
public RobotTool(string name, Mesh mesh, Plane attachmentPlane, Plane toolPlane, bool robotHold, double mass, Vector3d centerOfGravity, Quaternion centerOfGravityOrientation, Vector3d inertia)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String name

The tool name, must be unique.
Rhino.Geometry.Mesh mesh

The tool mesh.
Rhino.Geometry.Plane attachmentPlane

The attachement plane.
Rhino.Geometry.Plane toolPlane

The tool center point and tool orientation as a plane.
System.Boolean robotHold

Boolean that indicates if the robot is holding the tool or if the tool is stationary.
System.Double mass

The weight of the tool in kg.
Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d centerOfGravity

The center of gravity of the tool load.
Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion centerOfGravityOrientation

The orientation of the tool load coordinate system defined by the principal inertial axes of the tool load. Expressed in the wrist coordinate system as a quaternion (q1, q2, q3, q4).
Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d inertia

The moment of inertia of the load in kgm2.

RobotTool(String, Mesh, Point3d, Quaternion)

Defines a robot tool from the TCP point and the TCP orientation defined as a quatertion. With load data as defined for the default tool tool0. The attachment plane is set to WorldXY.

Declaration
public RobotTool(string name, Mesh mesh, Point3d point, Quaternion quat)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String name

The tool name, must be unique.
Rhino.Geometry.Mesh mesh

The tool mesh defined in the tool coordinate space.
Rhino.Geometry.Point3d point

The point of the tool center as point
Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion quat

The orientation of the tool center point as quarternion

RobotTool(String, Mesh, Double, Double, Double, Double, Double, Double)

Defines a robot tool from Euler data with load data as defined for the default tool tool0. The attachment plane is set to WorldXY.

Declaration
public RobotTool(string name, Mesh mesh, double toolTransX, double toolTransY, double toolTransZ, double toolRotX, double toolRotY, double toolRotZ)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String name

The tool name, must be unique.
Rhino.Geometry.Mesh mesh

The tool mesh.
System.Double toolTransX

The tool center point translation in x-direction.
System.Double toolTransY

The tool center point translation in y-direction.
System.Double toolTransZ

The tool center point translation in z-direction.
System.Double toolRotX

The orientation around the x-axis in radians.
System.Double toolRotY

The orientation around the y-axis in radians.
System.Double toolRotZ

The orientation around the y-axis in radians.

RobotTool(String, Mesh, Double, Double, Double, Double, Double, Double, Double)

Defines a robot tool from the x, y and z coordinate and the four quarternion values. With load data as defined for the default tool tool0. The attachment plane is set to WorldXY.

Declaration
public RobotTool(string name, Mesh mesh, double x, double y, double z, double q1, double q2, double q3, double q4)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String name

The tool name, must be unique.
Rhino.Geometry.Mesh mesh

The tool mesh defined in the tool coordinate space.
System.Double x

The x coordinate of the TCP point.
System.Double y

The y coordinate of the TCP point.
System.Double z

The z coordinate of the TCP point.
System.Double q1

The real part of the quaternion.
System.Double q2

The first imaginary coefficient of the quaternion.
System.Double q3

The second imaginary coefficient of the quaternion.
System.Double q4

The third imaginary coefficient of the quaternion.

RobotHold

Defines whether or not the robot is holding the tool. Use true if the robot is holding the tool. Use false if the robot is not holding the tool (e.g. stationary tool).

Methods

Clear()

Clear / unset all the fields and properties of the object. Used for constructing an empty Robot Tool object. Since the empty constructor creates the default Robot Tool tool0.

Declaration
public void Clear()

Duplicate()

A method to duplicate the RobotTool object.

Declaration
public RobotTool Duplicate()
Returns
Type Description
RobotTool

Returns a deep copy for the RobotTool object.

DuplicateWithoutMesh()

A method to duplicate the RobotTool object without duplicating the mesh. It will set an empty mesh.

Declaration
public RobotTool DuplicateWithoutMesh()
Returns
Type Description
RobotTool

Returns a deep copy for the RobotTool object without a mesh.
